title: Aural - treble rhythm pattern with ties

content.question:
Question 7 asks you to identify a rhythm. After the question is announced, you will have ten seconds to read the choices. It is important that you read the choices carefully before the example is played. The example will be played twice, with a brief pause between playings. Now listen to the music for Question 7 and identify the rhythm that matches the example played.

Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Three measures of music in treble clef. The key signature has one flat and the time signature is two-four. The notes are eighth D4, eighth F4 tied to eighth F4, eighth A4, sixteenth G4, eighth E4, sixteenth D4 tied to sixteenth D4, sixteenth C-sharp 4, eighth A3, and half note D4.

Three measures of music in treble clef. The key signature has one flat and the time signature is two-four. The notes are eighth D4, eighth F4 tied to eighth F4, eighth A4, sixteenth G4, sixteenth E4, eighth D4 tied to sixteenth D4, sixteenth C-sharp 4, eighth A3, and half note D4.

Three measures of music in treble clef. The key signature has one flat and the time signature is two-four. The notes are eighth D4, eighth F4 tied to dotted eighth F4, sixteenth A4, eighth G4, sixteenth E4, sixteenth D4 tied to sixteenth D4, sixteenth C-sharp 4, eighth A2, and half note D4.

Three measures of music in treble clef. The key signature has one flat and the time signature is two-four. The notes are eighth D4, eighth F4 tied to dotted eighth F4, sixteenth A4, sixteenth notes G4, E4, D4, sixteenth C-sharp 4 tied to eighth C-sharp 4, eighth A2, and half note D4.

content.answer: Three measures of music in treble clef. The key signature has one flat and the time signature is two-four. The notes are eighth D4, eighth F4 tied to dotted eighth F4, sixteenth A4, eighth G4, sixteenth E4, sixteenth D4 tied to sixteenth D4, sixteenth C-sharp 4, eighth A2, and half note D4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
